Understanding WEBP: The Modern Image Format

WEBP is a modern image format developed by Google that provides superior compression for images on the web. WEBP supports both lossy and lossless compression, as well as transparency and animation.

Why WEBP is better than JPG: At the same visual quality, WEBP files are typically 25-35% smaller than equivalent JPG files. This means faster website loading, reduced bandwidth costs, and improved user experience.

Browser support: WEBP is now supported by all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari (iOS 14+), and Opera. Over 96% of global users can view WEBP images.

Frequently Asked Questions

Will converting JPG to WEBP improve my website speed?

Yes! WEBP images are typically 25-35% smaller than JPG at the same quality. This means your website pages will load faster, especially for image-heavy sites.

Do all browsers support WEBP images?

Yes, all modern browsers support WEBP: Chrome (since 2010), Firefox (since 2019), Edge (since 2018), Safari (since iOS 14/macOS Big Sur in 2020), and Opera. Over 96% of internet users can view WEBP images.

Can I convert WEBP back to JPG if needed?

Yes! Use our WEBP to JPG Converter to convert back to JPG format.
